verses.verse: My soul <WH5315> is weary <WH5354> of my life <WH2416>; I will give free course <WH5800> to my complaint <WH7879>; I will speak <WH1696> in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul <WH5315>.
I will say <WH559> unto God <WH433>, Do not condemn <WH7561> me <WH3045>; Show me wherefore thou contendest with me <WH7378>.

Is it good <WH2895> unto thee that thou shouldest oppress <WH6231>, That thou shouldest despise <WH3988> the work <WH3018> of thy hands <WH3709>, And shine <WH3313> upon the counsel <WH6098> of the wicked <WH7563>?
Hast thou eyes <WH5869> of flesh <WH1320>? Or seest <WH7200> thou as man <WH582> seeth <WH7200>?
Are thy days <WH3117> as the days <WH3117> of man <WH582>, Or thy years <WH8141> as man <WH1397>'s days <WH3117>,
That thou inquirest <WH1245> after mine iniquity <WH5771>, And searchest <WH1875> after my sin <WH2403>,
Although thou knowest <WH1847> that I am not wicked <WH7561>, And there is none that can deliver <WH5337> out of thy hand <WH3027>?
Thy hands <WH3027> have framed <WH6087> me and fashioned <WH6213> me Together <WH3162> round about <WH5439>; yet thou dost destroy me <WH1104>.
Remember <WH2142>, I beseech thee <WH6213>, that thou hast fashioned me as clay <WH2563>; And wilt thou bring <WH7725> me into dust <WH6083> again <WH7725>?
Hast thou not poured me out <WH5413> as milk <WH2461>, And curdled <WH7087> me like cheese <WH1385>?
Thou hast clothed <WH3847> me with skin <WH5785> and flesh <WH1320>, And knit <WH7753> me together with bones <WH6106> and sinews <WH1517>.
Thou hast granted <WH6213> me life <WH2416> and lovingkindness <WH2617>; And thy visitation <WH6486> hath preserved <WH8104> my spirit <WH7307>.
Yet these things thou didst hide <WH6845> in thy heart <WH3824>; I know that this is with thee <WH3045>:
If I sin <WH2398>, then thou markest <WH8104> me <WH5352>, And thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity <WH5771>.

If I be wicked <WH7561>, woe <WH480> unto me <WH6663>; And if I be righteous, yet shall I not lift up <WH5375> my head <WH7218>; Being filled <WH7649> with ignominy <WH7036>, And looking <WH7202> upon mine affliction <WH6040>.
And if my head exalt <WH1342> itself <WH6679>, thou huntest me as a lion <WH7826>; And again <WH7725> thou showest thyself marvellous upon me <WH6381>.
Thou renewest <WH2318> thy witnesses <WH5707> against me <WH7235>, And increasest thine indignation <WH3708> upon me <WH5978>: Changes <WH2487> and warfare are with me <WH6635>.
Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth <WH3318> out of the womb <WH7358>? I had given up the ghost <WH1478>, and no eye <WH5869> had seen me <WH7200>.
I should have been as though I had not been <WH2986>; I should have been carried from the womb <WH990> to the grave <WH6913>.
Are not my days <WH3117> few <WH4592>? cease <WH2308> then <WH7896>, And let me alone, that I may take comfort <WH1082> a little <WH4592>,
Before I go <WH3212> whence I shall not return <WH7725>, Even to the land <WH776> of darkness <WH2822> and of the shadow of death <WH6757>;
The land <WH776> dark <WH5890> as midnight <WH652>, The land of the shadow of death <WH6757>, without any order <WH5468>, And where the light <WH3313> is as midnight <WH652>.
